cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Ian is tracking northwest toward western Cuba, then turning north across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and is forecast to approach the west coast of Florida mid-week, before crossing the peninsula and moving into the Atlantic late week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood southward to Chokoloskee on Florida’s southwest coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Lower Florida Keys from Seven Mile Bridge westward to Key West and Dry Tortugas; Storm-Surge Watch Anclote River southward to Card Sound Bridge, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Anclote River to Bonita Beach (highest surge 5–8 ft) and much of the Florida peninsula for heavy rain and wind
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained ≥39 mph) possible Tuesday night through Wednesday with a peak 1-in-5 chance; brief gusts could exceed 50 mph in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat is indicated for the Atlantic side near Port Everglades; highest surge values remain along Florida’s west coast and Florida Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain possible across southeast Florida Tuesday–Thursday, producing localized flash-flooding in low-lying terminal and access-road areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes are possible Tuesday into Wednesday across the southern and central Florida Peninsula, including the Port Everglades area; high surf and dangerous rip currents expected along Atlantic beaches.
